feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 20 at 5:21AM AKDT until August 20 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Near Donnelly Dome. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS ANCHORAGE THROUGH TONIGHT... An additional 0.20" to "0.30" is expected for the Anchorage Bowl Saturday morning through Saturday night. This is due to the persistent moist, southwest flow aloft around an upper level low. Rainfall should taper off by Sunday morning with just a few

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... Moderate to severe drought conditions across the Berkshires and northwestern Connecticut will result in elevated fire weather concerns today. Relative humidity values will drop to 35 to 40 percent this afternoon with southerly winds of 5 to 10 mph and

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... The potential for fire spread is enhanced. The prolonged absence of wetting rains, along with moderate to severe drought conditions, have led to very dry soil moistures and ground fuels. Any fire that ignites will easily and rapidly spread in these conditions.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:34PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE TORNADO WARNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN JONES AND NORTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES HAS EXPIRED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer appears capable of producing a tornado. Therefore, the warning has been allowed to expire. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 12:20PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONDITIONS REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR FUNNEL CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON... Current atmospheric conditions support the development of funnel clouds. Spotters have reported funnel clouds near Beaman and Dike in Grundy County and Dysart in Tama County thus far. Usually, these funnel clouds can form from showers and weak thunderstorms. These funnels are normally brief, drop only

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. A few spots may briefly reach 110 this afternoon. entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Aransas Islands, Kleberg Islands, Nueces Islands and Calhoun Islands Counties. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday evening.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:27PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BEAVER AND NORTH CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 230 PM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However small hail and heavy rainfall is still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:27PM MDT until August 20 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BEAVER AND NORTH CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 230 PM MDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kane County through 300 PM MDT... At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Cedar Breaks National Monument, or 17 miles northeast of Zion National Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Dane, Green, Iowa and Lafayette. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following county, Milwaukee. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 20 at 9:05AM CDT until August 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.
